docs.lead_paragraph: In exempting a Christian college from a federal regulation, the Supreme Court’s male justices make another move that could hamper universal contraception coverage.
docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes temporary order approved by Supreme Court that appears to free Wheaton College from having to go through exemption process that religious nonprofits must go through to deny employees contraception health coverage; warns that order, which stems from court's ruling in Hobby Lobby case, could hamper universal contraception coverage, and calls for order to be reversed.
docs.snippet: In exempting a Christian college from a federal regulation, the Supreme Court’s male justices make another move that could hamper universal contraception coverage.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: In recent years, generic drugs have saved the health care system billions, but increasingly the costs of some generics are going the other way.

headline.main: Rapid Price Increases for Some Generic Drugs Catch Users by Surprise
headline.print_headline: Rapid Price Increases for Some Generic Drugs Catch Users by Surprise

docs.abstract: Costs of some generic drugs, far cheaper to bring to market than brand-name pharmaceuticals, are nonetheless rising despite plentiful supply and ease of manufacture; Federal Trade Commission has been examining anticompetitive practices in generic drug industry but there is little that can be done if monopoly happens naturally as competing companies leave the market.
docs.snippet: In recent years, generic drugs have saved the health care system billions, but increasingly the costs of some generics are going the other way.

docs.lead_paragraph: Most independent centers cannot match the salary and benefits given by New York City's Education Department, causing an unintended result of a mayoral initiative.

headline.main: As New York City Expands Pre-K, Private Programs Fear Teacher Drain
headline.print_headline: As City Expands Pre-K, Private Programs Fear Teacher Drain

docs.abstract: Directors of dozens of independently run prekindergarten programs in New York City say they cannot compete with salary and benefits offered by Education Department, and fear drain of teachers; city is aiming to provide up to 53,000 full-day prekindergarten seats in fall 2014, more than double amount in 2013, with 40 percent of seats in public schools.
docs.snippet: Most independent centers cannot match the salary and benefits given by New York City's Education Department, causing an unintended result of a mayoral initiative.

docs.lead_paragraph: The legislation, which faces long odds in the House, would ensure that women have access to insurance coverage for birth control even if they work for businesses that have religious objections.

headline.main: Democrats Push Bill to Reverse Supreme Court Ruling on Contraceptives
headline.print_headline: Democrats Push Bill to Reverse Supreme Court Ruling on Contraceptives

docs.abstract: House and Senate Democrats announce development of bill that would override Supreme Court's decision on contraceptives, and require that for-profit corporations like Hobby Lobby Stores provide and pay for contraceptive coverage under the Affordable Care Act.
docs.snippet: The legislation, which faces long odds in the House, would ensure that women have access to insurance coverage for birth control even if they work for businesses that have religious objections.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Democrats hope to turn their legal setback on Obamacare and contraception into a winning autumn campaign issue by pushing legislation requiring employers to include birth control in healthcare coverage.

headline.main: U.S. Democrats Aim to Turn Contraception Into Campaign Drive
headline.print_headline: U.S. Democrats Aim to Turn Contraception Into Campaign Drive

docs.snippet: U.S. Democrats hope to turn their legal setback on Obamacare and contraception into a winning autumn campaign issue by pushing legislation requiring employers to include birth control in healthcare coverage.

docs.lead_paragraph: Local universities expressed concern Tuesday that a proposed College Athletes Bill of Rights would cost them scholarships and commit them to lifelong health insurance for players who are injured during games.

headline.main: Boston City Council Talks College Athlete Rights
headline.print_headline: Boston City Council Talks College Athlete Rights

docs.snippet: Local universities expressed concern Tuesday that a proposed College Athletes Bill of Rights would cost them scholarships and commit them to lifelong health insurance for players who are injured during games.

docs.lead_paragraph: The number of U.S. homes with only cellphones is growing, with 41 percent of them without landlines in the second half of 2013, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Two in Five U.S. Homes Have Only Cellphones: Survey
headline.print_headline: Two in Five U.S. Homes Have Only Cellphones: Survey

docs.snippet: The number of U.S. homes with only cellphones is growing, with 41 percent of them without landlines in the second half of 2013, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said on Tuesday.

docs.abstract: Mr. Bailey’s compensation as Burberry chief executive and chief creative officer has raised an outcry, but there are several factors to consider.
docs.snippet: Mr. Bailey’s compensation as Burberry chief executive and chief creative officer has raised an outcry, but there are several factors to consider.

headline.main: Christian Pastor Sentenced to 12 Years in Chinese Prison

docs.abstract: A court in Henan Province has sentenced a Christian pastor to 12 years in jail on charges his lawyer said were baseless, illegal and rooted in the pastor’s attempts to help local parishioners gain justice.
docs.snippet: A court in Henan Province has sentenced a Christian pastor to 12 years in jail on charges his lawyer said were baseless, illegal and rooted in the pastor’s attempts to help local parishioners gain justice.
